result.execSummary:
The defendant David A Espinoza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Cocaine (>15-40g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)3.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of  3 1/2 years bifurcated sentence.
Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Statutory court costs assessed.  Bond to apply.
It is a condition of probation that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  
Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.  
DNA sample and pay fee.
Alcohol/drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. Random UA's at discretion of agent.

timeConds.notes: Mus serve 6 months with CFTS.  6 months stayed.  Huber for employment, treatment and child care.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David A Espinoza

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: ***ADDED CONDITION FOR DEFT TO BE ALLOWED TO PICK UP CHILD FROM SCHOOL***  Def. has until 05:00 pm on 02/14/2014/ to post or report to RCJ.   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions are going to court, meeting with atty, going to work.   You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Department Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
